content: Singaporean diplomat **Albert Chua** (born 1968) is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporean) civil servant and diplomat who is the [Permanent Secretary](/wiki/Permanent_secretary) of the [Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Singapore](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Singapore)). He also served as Permanent Representative of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) to the [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations) from 2011 to 2013. ## Education He was educated at [Raffles Institution](/wiki/Raffles_Institution), the [University of East Anglia](/wiki/University_of_East_Anglia) (BA, English Literature, 1990) and [Harvard Kennedy School](/wiki/Harvard_Kennedy_School) at [Harvard University](/wiki/Harvard_University) (MPA, 2000). ## Career Chua joined the [Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Singapore)) in 1992, serving as Deputy Trade Representative at the Singapore Trade Office in Taipei from March 1994 to February 1997, and Deputy Secretary (Policy) of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from August 2001 to February 2004. He served as a Principal Private Secretary to then Senior Minister [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) from August 2004 to September 2007, and was appointed Singaporean High Commissioner to Australia from March 2008 to June 2011. He was appointed Permanent Secretary [(Foreign Affairs)](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Singapore)) in April 2022, having formerly been Permanent Secretary ([Sustainability and the Environment](/wiki/Ministry_of_the_Environment_and_Water_Resources)). He also served as a board member of the Middle East Institute and the Institute of South Asian Studies. ## Awards He received a Gold [Public Administration Medal](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam) in 2017.
